name: Syracuse Salt Potatoes
author: kaspmary
summary: Salt potatoes are a regional specialty of Syracuse, New York, a.k.a. The Salt City. Salt potatoes date to the 1800s, invented by local salt mine workers who created a simple and inexpensive lunch by boiling small potatoes in brine. The potatoes are still very popular today with the Central New York crowd, making an incredibly easy and delicious side dish.
directions: Wash the potatoes and set aside
Fill a large pot with water; stir in salt until it no longer dissolves and settles on the bottom
Place potatoes in the pot and bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer until potatoes are tender but firm, about 15 minutes
While the potatoes are cooking, melt the butter in a small pan over medium high heat, or in microwave
